comments.author: Alice
comments.content: Great post!  Any plans for more stages in the future?

comments.author: Jackie Baisa
comments.content: Fabulous blog. I enjoyed every minute of it! And I have the same question as Alice... any new plans on the horizon?

comments.author: Hsiao-Ching Chou
comments.content: Please do write about how the kitchen is broken down! I want to read more!

comments.author: molahs
comments.content: Thanks for this analysis. It read like a well written intro to "Kitchen Confidential: the Vegetarian Intern." I look forward to hearing more about your lessons learned and how they will ultimately inform the decision making process as you create your own eatery. As always, your blog is a fine blend of insight and inspiring recipes.

comments.author: Natalie Sztern
comments.content: Oh no you could keep on going I am loving and eating every word you've written...

comments.author: Delishhh
comments.content: Wow - great post i really enjoyed reading this.  I would love to hear more about prep and breakdown of kitchen.  Keep writing.

comments.author: maybelles mom
comments.content: this was a fabulous post--interesting and compelling writing.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @everyone - thanks for all of the thoughtful comments. I don't have immediate plans for a future stage but look forward to doing it again. We have so many great restaurants in this city, I could never stop learning. One thing I do have coming up is a demo at the Queen Anne Farmer's Market, 6/10 at 5:30 PM - I'll keep you all posted about that, it would be fun to meet some of you locals that I haven't run into before.

comments.author: Y
comments.content: Great post. I like the idea of someone cooking like the cool kid, without needing to show off :)

comments.author: Inanna
comments.content: I loved this post and would like to hear every detail of your two weeks..it's like a glimpse into another world...and I totally think restaurants are missing the boat on their bland veg entrees!!! I've started asking for a special plate that includes NO wheat to give them the hint that we eat something other than pasta!!!  And most of the plates have been incredible.

comments.author: Laura Plumb
comments.content: You are a brilliant writer. I am thoroughly enjoying every post, article, photograph and insight. Thank you for this gift of nourishing generosity.

comments.author: Aaron Adams
comments.content: Great post! Love your website! I would love to hear more about their philosophy of pre-prep and their breakdown of the kitchen. Can you illuminate us? I am on the edge of my seat, quite literally.  Thanks again! Awesome!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Aaron - Well, it has been a long time, so I'm not sure I have a lot of new stuff I can remember to add at this point, but we've got a great series of articles on organization and prep over at ChefSteps (where I work now):
  • Get Organized: optimizing your kitchen for efficiency
  • Preparation Overview: learning how to prep and mise en place
  • Work Clean: keeping your kitchen sanitary and uncluttered while cooking
